{"step_by_step_thinking": "Cryptogenic chronic liver disease refers to long-term liver disease that has no identifiable cause. Hepatitis G virus and TT virus are both types of viruses that can infect the liver. However, the role of these viruses in cryptogenic chronic liver disease is not well established. Some studies suggest a possible association, but the evidence is not strong enough to confirm a direct causal relationship. Therefore, it cannot be definitively stated that these viruses are involved in cryptogenic chronic liver disease.", "answer_choice": "C. maybe"}
